result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Bodily Harm or Threat to Employee of Health Care Facility or Family

2:07 PM Defendant James J. Hedden in court.  Court states case and appearances.  Court questions DE on his petition for court-appointed counsel.  DE is currently employed by Milwaukee Valve.  Court finds DE is not indigent and declines to appoint counsel for the DE.  Court reminds DE of his upcoming court dates.

2:32 PM Prosecuting attorney Rick C Spoentgen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant James J. Hedden appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Leonie Dolch appeared by video for James J. Hedden. Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  Advised of rights to an attorney.  DE has not yet contacted the PD's office.  Atty Dolch updates DE's address.  Time limits waived for preliminary hearing.  State requests $400 cash bond.  Atty Dolch recommends a signature bond or lower cash bond.  $1,000.00 SIGNATURE bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  Absolute sobriety at all times.  No possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid Rx.  No bars, taverns, liquor stores or any place where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol. and must submit chemical testing by law enforcement.
